== Main Inclusion Report for ecosconfig-imx ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/e/ecosconfig-imx]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of redboot-imx; a bootloader needed on the imx51 Babbage board.
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=ecosconfig|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: 0 for ecosconfig, 1 for ecos in 2006, but didn't affect the config tool
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=ecosconfig|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.
** No daemons.
** Does not use the network
** It does not process binary or structured data, but it does read a saved config file created by the tool itself
** No source code review performed.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** ecosconfig-imx has no configuration file; its used to config ecos (and redboot-imx)
** No debconf questions asked
** No Debian package.
** Upstream for this package (Freescale Semiconductors) is calm.
** No upstream bug tracker.
** Hardware: This package does not deal with hardware directly, but it does configure RedBoot for hardware:
    - The currently only supported target is the imx51-babbage board; but there may be addition targets added
** No test suite.
 0. ''UI standards:''
** User-visible strings are not internationalized, however this utility is not meant to be run by endusers
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliance
** Packaging system: debhelper
** Patch system: dpatch
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** tcl-dev, tk-dev
** All build-deps are in main
 0. ''Maintenance:''
** This is a low maintenance package; it will only have to be touched if a new upstream release is given by Freescale
** The Ubuntu Mobile Team is responsible for this package; they are Ubuntu developers.
 0. ''Background information:''
** eCos and Freescale call it eCos configuration tools.
 0. ''Internationalization:''
** No GUI apps.

=== Reviewers ===

MIR bug: <nowiki>[[https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/ecosconfig-imx/+bug/344990]]</nowiki>
